FuncDef:
The udp source-port command sets the source UDP port number or a port range carried in NQA test flows.
The undo udp source-port command restores the default source UDP port number or a port range carried in NQA test flows.
By default, the source UDP port number is 49184.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the source UDP port number or the start source UDP port number in a range.
The value is an integer ranging from 1025 to 65535.

Specifies the end source UDP port number.
The value is an integer ranging from 1025 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the source UDP port number carried in Ethernet service activation test packets, run the udp source-port command. The reflector can loop packets carrying the specified source UDP port numbers.
Precautions
For the same test flow, a range can be specified only in one of the traffic-type, vlan, pe-vid, udp destination-port, and udp source-port commands. In addition, the difference between the start and end values cannot be more than 127, and the end value must be greater than the start value.
